keyword: calories in a cup of chicken
title: Calories in a Cup of Chicken
meta_description: Discover calories in a cup of chicken, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: Calories in a Cup of Chicken
assumptions: Cooked, skinless, boneless chicken breast, diced or shredded; 1 cup ≈140g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, added fats or seasonings, and exact portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of cooked, skinless chicken breast provides ~231 kcal and ~43 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Use chicken thigh (dark meat) instead of breast
Add 1 tsp oil during cooking per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 231 kcal for 1 cup (140g) skinless, cooked chicken breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a cup of chicken?
faqs.a: About 43g of protein per cup of cooked, skinless chicken breast.
Plain cooked chicken breast has 0g carbs; breading or sauces add them.

faqs.q: How much fat in a cup of chicken?
faqs.a: Roughly 5g total fat, including 1.4g saturated, for skinless breast.

faqs.q: Is a cup of raw chicken the same calories as cooked?
faqs.a: No—raw is lower per cup due to water loss during cooking; use cooked weights for accuracy.
